Issues.Title: Hardware acceleration for Winforms
Issues.Body:
The Winforms in .NET Framework is using GDI+ to render graphics which is not hardware-accelerated.

Please support a way to use GPU acceleration for Winforms.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hardware acceleration for Winforms" (#601)

Issues.Title: Restore assembly-level CLSCompliant true & remove method-level instances of false CLS Compliance
Issues.Body:
1. Changed ClsCompliant to true at assembly level for all 3 implementation assemblies
2. (1) caused some compile time errors for instances in System.Windows.Forms where we have declared ClsCompliant to false at some methods and class levels. I removed those instances as all of them were in internal classes.

After this change there are no compile time errors and both unit tests and integration test passes.

I am not sure if there can be any runtime implications because of this change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Restore assembly-level CLSCompliant true & remove method-level instances of false CLS Compliance" (#584)

Issues.Title: Unify namespace macros
Issues.Body:
We need to unify these namespaces macros
WINFORMS_NAMESPACE 
WINFORMS_DESIGN_NAMESPACE
into DRAWING_DESIGN_NAMESPACE

Current name: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/search?q=DRAWINGDESIGN_NAMESPACE&unscoped_q=DRAWINGDESIGN_NAMESPACE

`DRAWINGDESIGN_NAMESPACE` should be changed to `DRAWING_DESIGN_NAMESPACE`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unify namespace macros" (#595)

Issues.Title: Unify common elements in csproj files and import them to prevent human error
Issues.Body:
example:

> Build failed: ```error CS8107: Feature 'default literal' is not available in C# 7.0. Please use language version 7.1 or greater.```
_Originally posted by @JuditRose in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/diffs_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unify common elements in csproj files and import them to prevent human error" (#594)

Issues.Title: Add Accessibility.dll to WinForms
Issues.Body:
This is a primary interop assembly for OLEACC.dll.

It's needed because both Winforms and WPF expose public types that depend on the
COM interop types in OLEACC so they cannot embed the types.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add Accessibility.dll to WinForms" (#593)

Issues.Title: AL.exe should be converted to .Net Core
Issues.Body:
_From @joperezr on November 16, 2015 19:50_

In order to build corefx repo using .Net Core version of msbuild, we require al.exe to run in .NetCore since we need to generate satellite assemblies. Today, if you try to build a project that needs this task will fail when trying to load it. There should be a workaround for the time being to disable the task from running, and once Al.exe is converted to net core it should be re-added back.

For this, I've used the .NetCore msbuild produced by https://github.com/dsplaisted/msbuild/tree/netcore-selfbuild


_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/msbuild#350_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "AL.exe should be converted to .Net Core" (#586)

Issues.Title: Move refout project settings to a targets file
Issues.Body:
As part of PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/237, we have added following two properties in each implementation assembly:
    
    <Deterministic>true</Deterministic>
    <ProduceReferenceAssembly>true</ProduceReferenceAssembly>

As per Eric's feedback, we should move them to Directory.Build.props under a conditional section like:

<PropertyGroup Condition="''$(IsShipping)' == 'true' And '$(IsFacadeAssembly)' != 'true'"> <!-- set properties to enable reference assembly generation -->

It means we will need to add IsShipping property in implementation assemblies.

But problem is that due to order of evaluation of props files, project properties are not available at that point. 

Hence we need to move these to a targets file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Move refout project settings to a targets file" (#583)

Issues.Title: Use ApiCompat to eusure public API compatibility with previous releases
Issues.Body:
Eric's feedback in PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/237

> "Use https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/tree/master/src/Microsoft.DotNet.ApiCompat to make sure your assemblies are compatible with desktop. @dreddy-work should have some familiarity with this, I helped him set it up on some of the facades previously on the internal codebase."
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use ApiCompat to eusure public API compatibility with previous releases" (#580)
